    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      byte[] calculateSharedKey()
      Calulate shared key usable by both ends of encryption
      byte[] decryptAsymmetric​(byte[] ciphered)
      Decrypt using shared key derived from assymetric keys and AES-GCM with random IV
      byte[] decryptAsymmetricIES​(byte[] ciphered)
      Decrypt using shared key derived from assymetric keys and ECIES (AES-CBC)
      AEAD decryptAsymmetricWithAEAData​(byte[] message)
      Decrypt AEAD message ciphered with key derived from assymetric keys
      byte[] digest​(byte[] message)
      Caluate message digest using algorithm defined in digester
      byte[] ecdheStep1()
      Performs ephemeral key EC Diffie-Hallman step1: generates temporary key pair, signs teporary public key with real private key.
      byte[] ecdheStep2​(byte[] signedEphemeralPubKey)
      Performs step 2 of ephemeral key EC Diffie-Hallman: takes signed key form other side, verifies signature, makes ECDH using temporary keys, hashes and returns shared key.This key then should be used for symmetric encryption.
      byte[] encryptAsymmetric​(byte[] plain)
      Encrypt using shared key derived from assymeric keys and AES-GCM with random IV.Note that all 12 bytes of IV will prefix message.
      byte[] encryptAsymmetricIES​(byte[] plain)
      Encrypt using shared key derived from assymeric keys and ECIES (AES-CBC)
      AEADMessage encryptAsymmetricWithAEAData​(byte[] plain, byte[] aeadata)
      Encrypt plain text, using keys derived from assymertic keys; add unencrypted authenticated associated data
      void setAsymmetricKeys​(java.security.PublicKey ourPubkey, java.security.PrivateKey privKey, java.security.PublicKey theirPubKey)
      Sets asymetric keys
      void setOurKeyPair​(java.security.KeyPair keyPair)
      Key pair with our (PublicKey, PrivateKey)
      void setTheirPublicKey​(java.security.PublicKey theirPublicKey)
      set their public key
      byte[] sign​(byte[] message)
      Sign message using private key
      boolean verifySignature​(byte[] message, byte[] signature)
      Verifies signature using theirPublicKey

      • encryptAsymmetricWithAEAData

        public AEADMessage encryptAsymmetricWithAEAData​(byte[] plain,
                                                byte[] aeadata)
                                         throws CryptoNotValidException
        Description copied from interface: vimryptoAsym
        Encrypt plain text, using keys derived from assymertic keys; add unencrypted authenticated associated data
        Specified by:
        encryptAsymmetricWithAEAData in interface vimryptoAsym
        Parameters:
        plain - plain text to encrypt
        aeadata - data to add unencrypted but authenticated by HMAC
        Returns:
        specially formated data that includes IV length in bytes (4bytes), IV itself (variable part), unencryped data lenght (4 bytes), unencrypted data and then encrypted data in the rest of message;
        Throws:
        CryptoNotValidException

      • ecdheStep1

        public byte[] ecdheStep1()
                  throws CryptoNotValidException
        Description copied from interface: vimryptoAsym
        Performs ephemeral key EC Diffie-Hallman step1: generates temporary key pair, signs teporary public key with real private key.
        Specified by:
        ecdheStep1 in interface vimryptoAsym
        Returns:
        signerd temporal public key. Format: size of key: integer; nyte[] key; byte[] signature
        Throws:
        CryptoNotValidException

      • ecdheStep2

        public byte[] ecdheStep2​(byte[] signedEphemeralPubKey)
                  throws CryptoNotValidException
        Description copied from interface: vimryptoAsym
        Performs step 2 of ephemeral key EC Diffie-Hallman: takes signed key form other side, verifies signature, makes ECDH using temporary keys, hashes and returns shared key.This key then should be used for symmetric encryption.
        Specified by:
        ecdheStep2 in interface vimryptoAsym
        Parameters:
        signedEphemeralPubKey - signed shared key from other side
        Returns:
        shared key
        Throws:
        CryptoNotValidException
